required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardio-vascular Protective Effects of Wolfberry in Middle-aged and Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Cardio-vascular Protective Effects of Wolfberry in Middle-aged and Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This purpose of this study is to assess the impact of consuming wolfberry on cardiovascular risk in Singapore's middle-aged and older adults. The investigators hypothesize that consuming wolfberry with a healthy eating pattern diet will contribute to improvements in cardiovascular health when compared to a similar diet without wolfberry.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a 16-week parallel, single-blind (investigator), prospective randomized controlled trial. The study was designed based on previous research which showed that consuming 15 g/day of wolfberry for 4 weeks and 14 g/day of wolfberry with meal for 6 weeks increased plasma zeaxanthin concentrations and antioxidant status. Also, other studies reported observable changes in the endothelial progenitor cells and flow mediated dilation after just two weeks of fruit and vegetables or healthy diet interventions. Thus collectively, 16-weeks may be a sufficient period to detect the changes in endothelial function, whole body carotenoids, and anti-oxidant status, which are the outcomes of interest in this research project.

primary_outcome.description: The main classes of lipids in the cell membrane

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Carotid Intima Media Thickness
primary_outcome.description: Carotid intima media thickness measured using high-frequency ultrasonographic imaging
Quantity and quality of circulating endothelial progenitor cells
Brachial artery flow mediated dilation measured using high-frequency ultrasonographic imaging
Concentrations of plasma total nitrate/nitrite using commercially available ELISA assay kits.
Fasting state plasma carotenoids using high performance liquid chromatography.
Concentrations of plasma endothelin-1 using commercially available ELISA assay kits.
Concentrations of plasma intercellular adhesion molecule-1 using commercially available ELISA assay kits.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at week 0, week 4, week 8, week 12 and week 16, week 0 and 16 reported
secondary_outcome.description: Total cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein cholesterol, and total triglyceride

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at week 0, week 4, week 8, week 12 and week 16, week 0 and 16 reported
secondary_outcome.description: Both systolic and diastolic blood pressure
Concentrations of plasma biomarkers of oxidative stress.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at week 0, week 4, week 8, week 12 and week 16, week 0 and 16 reported
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using resonance Raman spectroscopy to obtain a skin carotenoid status, a score which ranges from 10000 to 89000. Higher score represents higher concentration of carotenoids in skin, hence, an improved outcome

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at week 0, week 4, week 8, week 12 and week 16, week 0 and 16 reported
Assessed at week 0, week 4, week 8, week 12 and week 16, week 0 and 16 reported
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of waist circumference using World Health Organization guidelines

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at week 0, week 4, week 8, week 12 and week 16, week 0 and 16 reported
secondary_outcome.description: A subjective visual analogue scale consisting of a 100 mm line for each term (1) hunger; (2) fullness; (3) desire to eat; (4) prospective food consumption. Subjects respond by placing a mark on the line that is anchored with an extreme answer at either end (e.g. "not felt at all" and "felt the greatest") A composite appetite score is computed by: (hunger + desire to eat + (100 - fullness) + prospective food consumption) divided by 4. With a maximum score of 400 for the greatest possible appetite (represented by hunger = 100; desire to eat = 100; fullness = 0 and prospective food consumption = 100) and a minimum score of 0 (represented by hunger = 0; desire to eat = 0; fullness = 100 and prospective food consumption = 0)
Analysis of dietary carotenoids using 3-day food records
Measured using The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) and sleep evaluation questionnaire

arm_group.description: Each subject will be provided one-to-one dietary counselling by a research dietitian and an instruction sheet to achieve the healthy eating pattern diet. Subjects will also be provided specific instructions to cook and consume 15 g/day wolfberry as part of a mixed-meal.
Each subject will be provided one-to-one dietary counselling by a research dietitian and an instruction sheet to achieve the healthy eating pattern diet.

intervention.description: Consumption of cooked dehydrated wolfberry as part of a mixed meal.
Compliance to a healthy diet in accordance to recommendations by the Singapore Health Promotion Board.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Ability to give an informed consent
2. Age 50 to 75 years
3. Willing to follow the study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Significant change in weight (Â± 5% body weight) during the past 3 months
2. Allergy to wolfberry
3. Acute illness at the study baseline
4. Exercising vigorously over the past 3 months
5. Consistently following healthy eating pattern diet in the past 3 months
6. Smoking
7. Have an average weekly alcohol intake that above 21 units per week (males) and 14 units per week (females): 1 unit = 360 mL of beer; 150 mL of wine; 45 mL of distilled spirits)
8. Pregnant, lactating, or planning pregnancy in the next 6 months
9. Taking dietary supplements which may impact the outcome of interests (e.g. vitamin supplements, antioxidant supplement etc.)
10. Prescribed and taking antihypertensive/cholesterol-lowering/ type-2 diabetic medication which started less than 5 years prior to the intervention participation
11. Insufficient venous access to allow the blood collection

reference.citation: de Souza Zanchet MZ, Nardi GM, de Oliveira Souza Bratti L, Filippin-Monteiro FB, Locatelli C. Lycium barbarum Reduces Abdominal Fat and Improves Lipid Profile and Antioxidant Status in Patients with Metabolic Syndrome. Oxid Med Cell Longev. 2017;2017:9763210. doi: 10.1155/2017/9763210. Epub 2017 Jun 8.
Cheng CY, Chung WY, Szeto YT, Benzie IF. Fasting plasma zeaxanthin response to Fructus barbarum L. (wolfberry; Kei Tze) in a food-based human supplementation trial. Br J Nutr. 2005 Jan;93(1):123-30.

patient_data.ipd_description: Electronic copies of the data with identifiable participant information will be kept on a secure website with access limited to the principal investigator and her research staff. All data will be de-identified prior to statistical analyses

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Wolfberry With Healthy Diet
group.description: Each subject will be provided one-to-one dietary counselling by a research dietitian and an instruction sheet to achieve the healthy eating pattern diet. Subjects will also be provided specific instructions to cook and consume 15 g/day wolfberry as part of a mixed-meal. Wolfberry: Consumption of cooked dehydrated wolfberry as part of a mixed meal. Healthy diet: Compliance to a healthy diet in accordance to recommendations by the Singapore Health Promotion Board.

outcome.title: Change in Appetite
outcome.description: A subjective visual analogue scale consisting of a 100 mm line for each term (1) hunger; (2) fullness; (3) desire to eat; (4) prospective food consumption. Subjects respond by placing a mark on the line that is anchored with an extreme answer at either end (e.g. "not felt at all" and "felt the greatest") A composite appetite score is computed by: (hunger + desire to eat + (100 - fullness) + prospective food consumption) divided by 4. With a maximum score of 400 for the greatest possible appetite (represented by hunger = 100; desire to eat = 100; fullness = 0 and prospective food consumption = 100) and a minimum score of 0 (represented by hunger = 0; desire to eat = 0; fullness = 100 and prospective food consumption = 0)

Subjects respond by placing a mark on the line that is anchored with an extreme answer at either end (e.g. "not felt at all" and "felt the greatest") A composite appetite score is computed by: (hunger + desire to eat + (100 - fullness) + prospective food consumption) divided by 4. reported_events.desc: There is no known risk associated with the consumption of wolfberry or a healthy eating pattern diet according to earlier intervention studies of a similar nature

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: There are no limitations to this trial currently.
